website_summaries.verdict: The Lenovo is small enough to bring to the office, but powerful enough to meet high processing needs.
pros: Speedy start up and shut down, thanks to the 256-gigabyte SSD drive (with room for extra storage)
Speaker quality is superior to many similar models
The sleek design and light weight — a mere 5.5 pounds — make the Lenovo great for traveling
cons: Battery life isn't the best, and the display tends to be dim

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Build quality.
customer_reviews.text: After 5 months the power button has completely stopped working. I've never been totally happy with the build quality, especially in comparison to the other Lenovo laptops I've owned. After checking out the actual problem, it's the motherboard. Not a cheap or easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel James

customer_reviews.title: A steal for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far this has exceeded expectations. Best keyboard I've used hands down, speakers are awesome, good amount of storage for casual gamers but could probably hold around 10 or so average sized games. Plays DAI with zero issues. Nice USB ports, nice size, not too heavy. My only tiny complaint is that it shows fingerprints VERY easily but those can be wiped away.
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Looks, Feels, Sounds and Plays Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is wonderful. It does everything I hoped it would and more. It's absolutely perfect for gaming, as every game runs as smooth as butter. It's design is pleasing to look at with its black and red color scheme, and the added, adjustable, red backlight to the keyboard is also a great touch. The build is solid, and the speakers sound great for laptop speakers. Overall, this is an incredible buy, and the opportunity to pay this off in monthly payments is just another great thing to include. For anyone who's looking to invest in a gaming laptop, or even just a nice laptop in general, they should most definitely consider this!
customer_reviews.author: Aireal

customer_reviews.title: The build quality of this laptop is very low. ...

Those issues rarely inconvenience me, and I can pack it up and take it wherever I go and play anything on steam.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Oculus Rift
customer_reviews.text: Product reviews and advertisements across the web have stated this laptop to be 'VR-ready' or 'VR-capable'. This categorically isn't true with regards to the Oculus rift. The Y520 has an NVIDIA 1050 TI and an integrated graphics card. The HDMI out socket is dedicated to the latter and cannot currently (24 July 2018) be reconfigured to the former using nvidia optimus. What this means is that the HDMI out doesn't register with the Oculus during configuration and setup of the headset. Otherwise this is a good laptop for the money. If you have no interest in VR then this is worth your consideration.

Its extremely frustrating and I think I will probably return this laptop (which is a shame because I really liked the aesthetic of the laptop, and the specs). EDIT: UNINSTALLING AND REINSTALLING DRIVERS FIXED IT
